newsitem.title: FINLAND: Baltic Ice - More restrictions due after Christmas.
newsitem.headline: Baltic Ice - More restrictions due after Christmas.

text.p: Coastal ice formed quickly just below 64 degrees north in the Gulf of Bothnia and new restrictions to navigation will come into force on December 27, the Finnish Institute of Marine Research said on Monday.

There was considated ice outside the Finnish ports of Kemi, Oulu, Tornio and Raahe, and only ships with a deadweight above 2,000 tonnes and ice-classes IA or IB would be allowed from December 27, it said.
Ice outside Lulea in Sweden was thickening but there were no restrictions to shipping.

Further south in the Gulf of Bothnia, ice was forming in bays, with no restrictions to navigation. Two ice-breakers were operating in the Northern end of the Gulf of Bothnia and one just North of Vaasa, the institute said.
In the Gulf of Finland, two ice-breakers were operating outside St Petersburg where ice was thickening and reached a thickness of 10 to 15 centimetres.
Outside Vyborg and Kotka, ice was fast while other ports in
in the Gulf of Finland remained clear.
PORT TEMP ICE TYPE THICKNESS RESTRICTIONS
Kotka, Hamina n/a New/fast n/a None
Oulu n/a Fast/compact 20-40 class IA, IB
Kemi n/a Fast/compact 10-40 class IA, IB.
(NOTE: New ice - forming, thin and still moving. Fast ice -
not moving level flat ice. Level ice - thick flat ice.
